Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: Draw two plants, one with water and one without, showing that they look different (student might depict one plant as drooping or smaller).
Attempt to illustrate how light affects plants by drawing one plant in sunlight and possibly indicating the other is not, though with mixed clarity.
Show a basic sense that plants with water are healthier, possibly through color or size differences.
CANNOT: Accurately depict or label that plants without water do not grow well, as they might not fully represent wilting or drying (student may draw both plants as still somewhat similar).
Clearly show the effect of light in terms of plant health, potentially misinterpreting the importance of light (student might draw a plant in darkness appearing equally healthy).
Consistently use patterns to demonstrate understanding of plant needs, as patterns or changes over time might be missing or inaccurately depicted.
